metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45939 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shellmetacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.cuses the system C library function in its implementation of the ctagsprogram. For example, a victim may use the "ctags *" command (suggested inthe ctags documentation) in a situation where the current working directoryhas contents that depend on untrusted input.

criterions.comment: xemacs21: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xemacs21-packages: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
emacs24: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
